comments.author: margaret davis

comments.text:
Yes this video is cute and all, but this animal should be in the wild where 
it belongs, not perpetuating an already over-endorsed industry of selling 
these animals for people to get amusement out of them as pets. Yes I can 
read the description which says she is domestically bred, but this is the 
inherent problem. Breeding these animals out of their natural environment 
means they become accustomed to a life of natural deprivation, and they 
will never be able to live the way they are meant to, all for the sake of 
our entertainment. Is this worth it?﻿

comments.author: RMXStudioJD

comments.text:
I know that it is better for her to be in her natural habitat and all, but 
we do have to bear in mind that she was born domestically---to be precise 
in a Japanese pet shop *LOOK IN THE DESCRIPTION BOX* so that means if they 
were to let her free in the wild she will not be able to survive.
However looking on the bright side by the looks of this video she does not 
seem to be harmed or abused and she seems to be looked after quite well, so 
I feel that she seems to be more safer there in that home than the wild 
where she is more likely to fall victim to being killed for medicine plus 
being smuggled into countries so they can have them as pets (this may be 
the case for Kinako's "parents" here) which they are slowly becoming 
extinct this could be a away of saving them. But it may be better for them 
to be conserved within a zoo perhaps where they can help build a suitable 
environment for these type of adorable creatures such as putting them a 
dark place seeing as they are nocturnal animals and those quite strong 
lights in the video can actually hurt and worse damage their eyes.﻿

comments.author: Rebekah Wiles

comments.text:
So the first pickle is that it is indeed illegal to sell Slow Lorises in 
Japan - despite whether it has teeth or not, it likely ended up in a 
Japanese pet store as part of some sort of smuggling ring (as it often the 
case even in examples of breeding). The following problem is that these are 
awful pets - they're not simply not built to be domesticated house animals 
like cats or what have you. A good number of them (in conditions like 
these) die from malnutrition, disease, and other extraneous circumstances, 
rather than natural predation they face in the wild. The final note of 
concern here is that these poor little guys are endangered because of human 
interference; both in terms of habitat reduction and capture. The pet trade 
of the Slow Loris has had a huge number of effects on their poaching, 
mortality, and reproduction rates. If you like these little creatures - 
don't buy one. There are reserves you can sponsor and number of other 
protection alternatives you can fund where these sweet little things can 
enjoy space and live their lives in peace; free from this sort of direct 
human involvement and the subsequent problems that result from them being 
made a "pet" oriented commodity.﻿

comments.author: Te Tegusto

comments.text:
There is nothing wrong with this video. Stop being such trolls and get a 
life. This creature was raised in a loving environment and just because 
they are not out in the wild does not mean its wrong. Just because someone 
keeps an animal as a pet does not make them a monster. One bad apple does 
not have to ruin the bunch. If this was illegal it would not be so 
publicized. My family raises deer and we love and nurture them in an 
artificial environment for breeding, but does that make us monsters? No we 
love and care for the deer just as I'm sure this owner cares for this slow 
loris. So stop the nonsense with how this is wrong and just enjoy the 
footage of this cute animal thank you.﻿

comments.author: Bronykris art

comments.text:
+Bronykris art And yet you keep insulting me immaturaly. Whose the brat 
here? Who can't keep a polite voice in their typing, and has to get to the 
lowest level possible? Ad hominem arguments are unbecoming of you.

And excuse me for not postings sources; I can't do much on a mobile phone, 
thanks. Why not use the amazing machine you have at your fingertips to do 
your own research? Also, just because a video has a lot of positive 
feedback doesn't make it GOOD or RIGHT.

Plenty of people upvoted Nash Grier's videos; even supporting him when he 
continuously insulted trans/lgbt members. 

And another thing? I quite enjoy MLP, but bronies are the scum of the 
Earth. You've ruined a children's show with copious amounts of porn that 
make searching unsafe. At least the Steven Universe fandom has the common 
courtesy to tag all/most NSFW items as "Stephen Galaxy", so that the 
likelihood of a child stumbling upon those images is unlikely. Also, 
conventions? Multiple harassment reports of all kinds have been filed 
against those who call themselves bronies against MINORS. ADULT MEN, 
SEXUALLY HARASSING LITTLE GIRLS who are just trying to enjoy a con 
dedicated to a show they enjoy. It's disgusting, and I immediately distrust 
anyone who labels themselves a brony.

Also, MS Paint series...? Wow. That's a bit rude, don't you think? Besides, 
MS Paint can be great. Guess you've never seen Homestuck.
